tweet: Thanks for the birthday wishes!  Enjoying it in the car traveling back home-but we did stop off and tour the USS Alabama which was awesome.

It's not just humans serving our country. Thanks Zorro. http://t.co/pkmo1bqron

Visited Bigelow Aerospace in Las Vegas this week to check out the Bigelow Expandable Activity Module (BEAM) launching to ISS next year.

In Clarksville MO at Lock&Dam No 24 watching a barge go through. Pretty impressive! http://t.co/kohs1vs9Vz

They found some more video that we took from ISS of Egypt, Ireland and England. Enjoy. http://t.co/b1l8EUQcmD

Check out http://t.co/ImbFc88WmC for some interesting video showing our view from cupola of Italy, Greece, SF, Edwards AFB & Houston.
Just spent the Labor Day weekend watching my sons play 8 hockey games in 36 hrs. Watching from space was great, but live is better!
Best of luck to @coachbeckman and the #illini against Youngstown State! I-L-L...

Special day with some special people in DC. Visited Nat. Inst. for Health, wounded warriors & @TheChildrensInn @NIH.
@nareshforpeople fully recovered. ISS is a great place to live & work, but there is no place like home

Congrats to my very good friends @astro_reid & Alex for their safe arrival on ISS with their crewmate Max.  Enjoy the next 6 months!

@crazyolly1998 yes - we would love to - we have really good friends from South Africa
Thx to all for the kind words about the commencement address & special thx to the grads for having me back on campus. Good luck!
@juicewilliamsqb thx Juice. Great meeting an Illini gridiron hero that's giving back to @Illinois_Alma
@DavidMZapata @Starbucks thanks enjoyed the chat & enjoyed the phone call from my good friend Steve Swanson on ISS while I was at Starbucks
Just spent an incredible weekend at the Univ of Illinois. I love that place. Congrats to all the grads. Thx @Illinois_Alma
@MikeCunningham7 @PiKappaAlpha thanks and it was great to have a fellow Pike on stage!
@jgallo18 Thx!  And yes, I have the honor of officiating the ceremony tomorrow

@AndreaDarlas @CochranShow @bbicks29 @WGNRadio @NHLBlackhawks great show, tons of fun - go Hawks!  Best of luck to Steve in his doula career
@RyanBakerCBS2 great to see you again after so many years.  Enjoyed the interview - fun to be back in the land of the Illini!
On our way to Univ of Illinois for the weekend. I have the honor of giving the commencement address on Sat. Very excited!
Just watched my crewmates Rick, Koichi & Misha land after 188 days in space. Can't wait to see them back in Houston!
@Vaduva great question - I'll see if I can find out
Great day @ NASA Michoud outside New Orleans. Shared my experience on ISS, saw work on SLS & Orion, & heard the NO Jazz Orchestra
@DamaniRashad @Illinois_Alma my pleasure. Looking forward to being back on campus for graduation.
Had the privilege yesterday of going to mission control for the Exp38 plaque hanging ceremony honoring members of the ground team-Congrats!
Congrats to Steve, Rick, Koichi, & the EVA team for a very successful day yesterday!
“@julieann_rn: My family at dinner-the boys(+hubby)discussing terraforming planets-I'm shuffling through Pandora for good music” not normal?
@lweeze4 thank you - I could only do what I did because of the support of my family ( & my awesome wife - she's a trooper!)
@RMraw right back at you!  Great to hear from you! How are things in Italy?
@MacCurlyWurly supporting those on orbit, in training, & preparing for next generation vehicles
@MacCurlyWurly I could go back to the AF, but I still feel like I can serve the AF by staying at NASA as an astronaut
@tonyhawksusaf heavy!
@hamzeh9969 no - it's still bright!
@youreboringme I landed on March 10th
@MacCurlyWurly it varies for each person, but I was cleared to drive after a week & physically I feel like I never left
@BarbaraZec it's great to be back!  It's also great to hear from you!
Had another VO2 max test the other day. Happy to report a personal record. Re-adaptation to gravity is going well.
@UasRonaldlink01 yes-there is a six hr time difference between Houston and ISS time, but physically, changes in gravity can mask it
@hamzeh9969 once and I sure hope so!
@TaraKaliszewski @Astro_Clay it worked for me...but with the reintroduction to gravity I can relate!
Back to the grind today, medical experiments & rehab, but still enjoying planet Earth 🌎
@ISS_Research @terranceofyork @SpaceX @NASA It lived for about 6 weeks, grew a few inches tall, but inadequate light & food was its demise
Just returned from Russia on my last official Exp 38 trip.  Oleg & Sergey are doing well; already miss it & hope to fly with them again!
Post flight travel starts today. Back to Russia for debriefs & welcome home ceremonies. Flashbacks to training but this trip will be shorter
Haven't sent a msg in a while, but staying busy with the family. Just finished our taxes, space didn't keep the tax man away!

@hamzeh9969 Space is awesome, but I enjoy being here on Earth with my family.

I've been in space for about 165 days.  On day 166, I'm coming home!
Ran for ~1 orbit today.  12 miles on the treadmill while the station travelled more than 25,000 miles. I've now run around the world.
a tutti i nostri amici da Parma, la città sembra altrettanto bello dallo spazio. un abbraccio http://t.co/DobpYNBRcL

@blakeshelton Living the dream!.9 days to go before we close the hatch and head  back to earth.

Heartland of America.  Has a certain beauty to it. http://t.co/vJtwwBl1ry

Every time we fly over the Bahamas I am blown away by the color of the water so I have to take more pictures. http://t.co/PXODGqn3ut
Kochi already tweeted, but another pic of Cyclone Guito near Madagascar.  Hope everyone stayed safe! http://t.co/ocJph3vPOF

Had a videoconference with @blakeshelton today while flying over New Zealand. I really enjoyed talking to him. Great guy.
Said goodbye to Cygnus yesterday.  Learning from the robotic arm master Koichi Wakata during the release. http://t.co/dJDorU16lU
Lake of the Ozarks in Missouri.  Big shout out to my high school, School of the Osage (near the middle of pic) http://t.co/TbPJVYCVFA
Another trip down memory lane. Played game at Arizona Stadium during my time as an Illini. Lost to fumblerooski http://t.co/TqMJeLhsP9

Maintenance day on the treadmill. Only 4 bolts hold the track in place. http://t.co/ihfuqCa3QA
Sorry about the lack of tweets.  Cosiguina volcano in Nicaragua.  Looks like an interesting place to visit. http://t.co/H0ym4qVx7E
Performed experiment yesterday collecting my blood pressure after restricting  blood flow to legs for 3 min. http://t.co/NSYZ6k8BEH
